meanings.definition: a tenant farmer who gives a share of the crops grown to the landlord in exchange for the use of the land
meanings.sent1: The sharecropping system allowed farmers to work the land in return for a portion of the harvest.
meanings.sent2: Sharecropping was a common arrangement in the South after the Civil War.
meanings.sent3: The sharecropping agreement turned out to be a win-win situation for both the farmer and the landlord.
meanings.sent4: In the world of agriculture, sharecropping can be seen as a symbiotic relationship between the landowner and the farmer.
meanings.sent5: The concept of sharecropping can be traced back to historical farming practices.

meanings.definition: the practice of sharecropping, typically involving a tenant farmer and a landlord
meanings.sent1: During the sharecropping era, many farmers relied on this system to work the land.
meanings.sent2: Sharecropping was a way for farmers to access land without owning it.
meanings.sent3: The sharecropping setup sometimes led to unexpected friendships between farmers and landlords.
meanings.sent4: In some regions, sharecropping was the backbone of the agricultural economy.
meanings.sent5: The history books are filled with stories of sharecropping families and their struggles.

meanings.definition: to engage in the practice of sharecropping
meanings.sent1: Farmers would sharecrop to have access to land for cultivation.
meanings.sent2: Many families sharecropped in order to make a living off the land.
meanings.sent3: The decision to sharecrop was a pivotal moment for the struggling farmer.
meanings.sent4: Sharecropping allowed farmers to work the fields without the burden of land ownership.
meanings.sent5: To sharecrop effectively, farmers needed to understand the terms of the agreement.
